definition: murky darkness suddenly opens (idiom); a sudden flash of insight and all is clear
reeds/rushes
surname Mao
Serbia/Serbian/abbr. for 塞爾維亞|塞尔维亚[Sai1 er3 wei2 ya4]
to stop up/to squeeze in/to stuff/cork/stopper
strategic pass/tactical border position
to stop up/to stuff/to cope with
to stop/to pause/to arrange/to lay out/to kowtow/to stamp (one's foot)/at once/classifier for meals, beatings, scoldings etc: time, bout, spell, meal

to open/to start/to turn on/to boil/to write out (a prescription, check, invoice etc)/to operate (a vehicle)/carat (gold)/abbr. for Kelvin, 開爾文|开尔文[Kai1 er3 wen2]/abbr. for 開本|开本[kai1 ben3], book format

sentences.english: Just read Leeao's book " The True Face of Chen Shui Bian" you will be enlightened.
sentences.chinese: 不妨读读李敖的《陈水扁真面目》，你将会茅塞顿开。

sentences.english: It occurred to me that this little creature might have some thoughts on the subject.
sentences.chinese: 顿时觉得，似乎这个小东西会令我茅塞顿开。

sentences.english: Kuester said that it was this humorous response made by the priest that inspired him.
sentences.chinese: 西勒库斯特说，正是牧师的这一幽默，让他茅塞顿开。

sentences.english: Seek the blessings and guidance of a higher authority and they might just show you the right path.
sentences.chinese: 向长辈寻求开导和指引吧，或许你能茅塞顿开。

sentences.english: The chart is below, and it's both an eye-opener and a spine-tingler.
sentences.chinese: 以下是比较图表，让人既茅塞顿开，也脊背发凉。

sentences.english: If I can, I really want to be a good person.
sentences.chinese: 希望某天茅塞顿开这种事也能发生在我身上。

sentences.english: It will definitely get people to do a double take. What do you guys think?
sentences.chinese: 它完全让人茅塞顿开，你觉得呢？

definition: lit. to anoint your head with the purest cream (idiom); fig. to enlighten people with perfect wisdom/flawless Buddhist teaching
to benefit (from)
suddenly opens up to a wide panorama (idiom); to come to a wide clearing/fig. everything becomes clear at once/to achieve speedy enlightenment
the content of a conversation/words/remarks
to give instructions/to give advice
a flash of realization/the truth in a flash/a moment of enlightenment (usually Buddhist)
lit. to dispel the clouds and see the sun (idiom); fig. to restore justice
gems of wisdom (idiom); priceless advice
enlightening remarks (honorific)/brilliant views
suddenly and completely (realize, change one's strategy etc)
lit. slap the table and shout with praise (idiom); fig. wonderful!/amazing!/great!
to submit cheerfully/to accept willingly (idiom)
to suddenly realize/to suddenly see the light
to hit the mark with a comment (idiom)/to say sth spot on
to comprehend (new things) by analogy
grasp this fundamental point and all the rest will follow (idiom)
